Constructor export with ES6 classes.

class Constructor {
  constructor(property) {
    this.porperty = property
  }
  method() {}
}
module.exports = Constructor;

Instance export.

Sometimes recognized as Singleton pattern for Node.JS but in some cases, like circular requiring, you can create multiple instances using Node.JS Instance pattern.

class Constructor {
  constructor(property) {
    this.porperty = property
  }
  method() {}
}
const singleInstance = new Constructor('value');
module.exports = singleInstance;

No export pattern.

Can be used to modify globally accessible objects or variable. As an example below listed a code for helper module for testing which overrides console.log in order to illuminate possibility log to console for the code under tests.

console.log = () => {}
